N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 166.5 - Allocation and use of funds

State Regulations
(a) Eligible agencies whose applications have been approved shall be eligible for
an allocation of funds under this Part. (b) An eligible agency may use the funds to: (1)
operate and administer a basic skills
educational, English-as-a-second-language, high school equivalency preparation, or job-related literacy program for employees of public or private employers
who are represented by labor organizations which operate or participate in the
operation of the program or for members of such labor organizations; (2)
provide counseling or support services or
develop new curricula for such workplace literacy programs; (3)
enter into a consortium with
organizations of employers to operate a workplace literacy program; and/or
(4)
contract with an
approved not-for-profit educational agency to provide workplace literacy
instruction. (c) Payment
of all or any part of a grant may be suspended or terminated by the
commissioner, if an eligible agency fails to comply with the provisions of the

Education Law, with this Part, or with any other applicable law or regulation; or if he finds that the program is not being implemented or administered in a
satisfactory manner or is failing substantially to effectuate the purpose of
the grant. (d) Nothing in this Part
shall be construed to prevent the use of funds obtained from other sources in
the planning, execution or evaluation of programs. Notes
